page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our block contains a mixture of sub-urban,rural and industrial land use. The main features of our area are Marchon chemical works,Mirehouse Housing Estate of Whitehaven,Sandwith village(pronounced Sanath locally) and the rural nature of the southern part of the block which incorporates farms and large mansion type houses. The block is traversed by one main road(A595) and the road between Whitehaven and St.Bees(B5345).The main railway also cuts the block running north-south,travelling through Mirehouse and is the rail link connecting Carlisle and Barrow.The railway section in the block links Whitehaven and St.Bees.Mineral railway lines from Bigrigg Iron Ore mines are no longer in existence but the route is still visible.
